intro: Phacelia californica f. bernardina, commonly known as Bernard's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
